SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AbstractClient
Abstract base implementation of the Client interface, providing shared logic and lifecycle management for both local (in-memory) and remote (WebSocket-based) Flux clients.
AbstractConverter<I,O>
An abstract base class for converting data of type I to type O.
AbstractSerializer<I>
Abstract base implementation of the Serializer interface.
AbstractUserProvider
Abstract base class for implementing UserProviders that resolve user identities via a metadata key.
AbstractWebsocketClient
Abstract base class for all WebSocket-based clients in the Flux Capacitor Java client.
AbstractWebsocketClient.PingRegistration
 
AdhocDispatchInterceptor
A DispatchInterceptor that enables thread-local, dynamically scoped interceptors during message dispatch.
Aggregate
Marks a class as the root of an aggregate in the domain model.
AggregateEventStream<T>
A wrapper around a stream of aggregate events, enriched with metadata such as the aggregate ID and the last known sequence number.
AggregateRepository
Repository interface for loading, managing, and repairing aggregates in Flux Capacitor.
AggregateRoot<T>
Represents the root of an aggregate in a domain model.
Alias
Annotation used on properties of an entity value that provide an alternative identifier to find the entity.
AllConstraint
A composite constraint that requires all inner constraints to match.
AnnotatedCaster<T>
Represents a dynamically discovered casting method (annotated with Upcast or Downcast) that is bound to a specific data revision and type.
AnnotatedEntityHolder
Helper class for Entity instances that manage nested entity relationships annotated with @Member.
AnyConstraint
A composite constraint that requires at least one inner constraint to match.
Append
Command to publish messages to a specific log in Flux (e.g., commands, events, metrics, etc.).
Append.Metric
Metric payload used for internal monitoring and logging.
AppendEvents
Command used to append one or more event batches to the event store.
AppendEvents.Metric
Compact metric representation of an AppendEvents command.
ApplicationEnvironmentPropertiesSource
A PropertySource that loads environment-specific properties from an application-<env>.properties file on the classpath.
ApplicationProperties
Central utility for resolving configuration properties within a Flux application.
ApplicationPropertiesSource
A PropertySource implementation that loads properties from an application.properties file located on the classpath.
AppliedEvent
Represents an event that has been applied to an aggregate along with its intended publication strategy.
Apply
Indicates that a method or constructor applies an update to an entity, or creates or deletes an entity.
AssertLegal
Annotation to mark methods or fields that assert whether a command or query is legal, given the current state of an aggregate.
Association
Declares how a message should be routed to a stateful handler instance (typically annotated with Stateful).
AuthenticatingInterceptor
 
Backlog<T>
A thread-safe batching queue that asynchronously flushes its content to a consumer in configurable batch sizes.
Backlog.BatchConsumer<T>
A function that consumes a batch of items and returns a future that completes when processing is done.
BatchingHandlerRepository
A batching wrapper for HandlerRepository that delays persistence operations until the end of the current message batch.
BatchInterceptor
Intercepts and decorates batch-level message handling for a Tracker.
BatchProcessingException
Exception thrown during message batch processing to intentionally halt tracking after a specific message.
BetweenConstraint
A Constraint that filters documents based on whether a value in a specific path lies between two bounds.
BooleanResult
A generic response containing a boolean value, typically used to indicate success/failure.
BulkUpdate
Represents a single operation in a bulk document update.
BulkUpdate.Type
Supported bulk operation types.
BulkUpdateDocuments
Command to perform a batch update of documents in the search/document store.
BulkUpdateDocuments.Metric
Metric representation for monitoring or observability.
Cache
A generic cache interface for storing and managing objects identified by unique keys.
CacheEvictionEvent
Represents an eviction event from a Cache.
CacheEvictionEvent.Reason
Indicates the cause for a cache entry eviction.
CacheEvictionsLogger
Logs and publishes cache eviction events as metrics.
CachingAggregateRepository
A wrapper around a delegate AggregateRepository that ensures cached aggregates stay in sync with the event log.
CachingTrackingClient
A TrackingClient implementation that wraps another client (typically a WebsocketTrackingClient) and caches recent messages in memory to reduce redundant round trips to the Flux platform.
CancelPeriodic
Exception used to cancel a periodic schedule from a schedule handler.
CancelSchedule
Command to cancel a previously scheduled message using its CancelSchedule.scheduleId.
Cast
Meta-annotation that indicates a method performs a revision-based type transformation.
Caster<I,O>
Functional interface representing a transformation from one stream of values to another, possibly adjusting for version compatibility or format changes.
CasterChain<I,O>
A composite Caster that supports registration of multiple casting strategies.
CastInspector
Internal utility for inspecting and instantiating caster methods based on annotations such as Upcast or Downcast.
CastParameters
Represents metadata that uniquely identifies a version of a serialized data type, along with an optional delta indicating how the revision should change after casting.
ChaCha20Poly1305Encryption
Implementation of Encryption using the ChaCha20-Poly1305 authenticated encryption algorithm.
ClaimSegment
A request to claim a message segment for consumption in client-controlled tracking mode.
ClaimSegmentResult
Result of a ClaimSegment request.
ClaimSegmentResult.Metric
Lightweight metric representation of a ClaimSegmentResult, used for telemetry.
Client
Defines the low-level client contract used by FluxCapacitorBuilder to construct a FluxCapacitor instance.
ClientDispatchMonitor
Functional interface for monitoring the dispatch of messages by a Client.
ClientEvent
Base interface for client lifecycle events such as ConnectEvent and DisconnectEvent.
ClientUtils
Utility class offering client-side support functions for working with Flux Capacitor.
CollectionMessageStore
A MessageStore implementation backed by a collection in an InMemorySearchStore.
Command
Base class for commands sent to the Flux platform.
CommandGateway
Gateway interface for publishing command messages in Flux Capacitor.
CompleteMessageEvent
 
CompressionAlgorithm
Enumeration of supported compression algorithms used for serializing and deserializing byte data.
CompressionUtils
Utility class for compressing and decompressing byte arrays using common compression algorithms.
ConditionalOnBean
Conditional that only matches when a bean of the specified type is present in the application context.
ConditionalOnBean.Condition
 
ConditionalOnMissingBean
Conditional that only matches when a bean of the specified type is not present in the context.
ConditionalOnMissingBean.Condition
 
ConditionalOnMissingProperty
Conditional that only matches when the specified property is either unset or blank.
ConditionalOnMissingProperty.Condition
 
ConditionalOnProperty
Conditional that only matches when a specific property is set and matches a given pattern.
ConditionalOnProperty.Condition
 
ConnectEvent
A platform-generated event that indicates a client has successfully connected to the Flux platform.
ConsistentHashing
Utility class for computing segment assignments using consistent hashing.
ConsoleError
A marker message type published to the Flux error gateway for error-level log entries.
ConsoleWarning
A marker message type published to the Flux error gateway for warning-level log entries.
Constraint
Base interface for defining filter conditions (constraints) used in document search queries.
Consumer
Declares a Consumer within a Flux application.
ConsumerConfiguration
Configuration class that defines how a message consumer behaves during message tracking and handler invocation.
ConsumerEndpoint
 
ContainsConstraint
A constraint that matches document entries containing the specified phrase, with optional wildcard-like flexibility.
ContentFilter
Represents an interface for filtering content before it is passed to a specified viewer.
Converter<I,O>
Interface for converting Data objects from one format or representation to another.
CookieParam
Injects the value of an HTTP cookie into a handler method parameter.
CorrelatingInterceptor
A DispatchInterceptor that enriches outgoing messages with correlation metadata, enabling full traceability across message flows within Flux Capacitor.
CorrelationDataProvider
Strategy interface for extracting correlation metadata from the current context.
CreateAuditTrail
Command to configure to use a search collection as a searchable audit trail.
CronExpression
This provides cron support for java8 using java-time.
CurrentUserParameterResolver
Resolves handler method parameters of type User.
Data<T>
A generic container for holding a value along with serialization metadata such as type, revision, and format.
DataProtectionInterceptor
A DispatchInterceptor and HandlerInterceptor that supports secure transmission of sensitive data fields by removing them from the payload before dispatch and restoring them during handling.
DecryptingPropertySource
A PropertySource decorator that transparently decrypts encrypted property values.
DefaultAggregateRepository
Default implementation of the AggregateRepository interface.
DefaultCache
Default implementation of the Cache interface using key-level synchronized access and soft references for value storage.
DefaultCasterChain<T,S>
Default implementation of the CasterChain interface used for managing and applying casting operations typically upcasting or downcastingon SerializedObject instances.
DefaultCasterChain.ConvertingSerializedObject<I,O>
A SerializedObject wrapper that applies a Converter to translate data from one format to another.
DefaultCasterChain.DataRevision
Represents a unique combination of serialized object type and revision, used as a key in the caster registry.
DefaultCommandGateway
Default implementation of the CommandGateway interface.
DefaultCorrelationDataProvider
Default implementation of the CorrelationDataProvider interface.
DefaultDocumentSerializer
Default serializer for Document instances in the Flux platform.
DefaultDocumentStore
 
DefaultEncryption
Default implementation of the Encryption interface used in the Flux platform.
DefaultEntityHelper
The DefaultEntityHelper provides the default implementation of the EntityHelper interface.
DefaultEntityHelper.DeserializingMessageWithEntity
Decorates a DeserializingMessage with an associated entity.
DefaultEntityHelper.MessageWithEntity

Default implementation of the ErrorGateway interface.
DefaultEventGateway
Default implementation of the EventGateway interface.
DefaultEventStore
Default implementation of the EventStore interface, providing mechanisms to store and retrieve events associated with aggregate instances.

Default implementation of the IndexOperation interface.

DefaultPropertySource
A layered PropertySource implementation used as the default source for resolving application properties in a Flux application.

Default implementation of the QueryGateway interface.
DefaultRepositoryProvider
A default implementation of the RepositoryProvider interface that uses a ConcurrentHashMap for each repository.

Default implementation of the RequestHandler interface.
DefaultResponseMapper
A default implementation of the ResponseMapper interface that simply wraps the response in a Message
DefaultResultGateway
Default implementation of the ResultGateway interface for sending response messages.
DefaultSnapshotStore
Default implementation of the SnapshotStore interface, responsible for managing snapshots of aggregate roots in an event-sourced system.
DefaultSocketSession
Default implementation of a SocketSession for managing Flux WebSocket sessions.
DefaultTracker
A tracker keeps reading messages until it is stopped (generally only when the application is shut down).
DefaultTracking
Default implementation of the Tracking interface that coordinates message tracking for a specific MessageType.
DefaultTrackingStrategy
Streaming strategy that allows multiple clients to concurrently consume a message stream.
DefaultTypeRegistry
 
DefaultWebRequestContext
Default implementation of WebRequestContext that adapts a DeserializingMessage of type MessageType.WEBREQUEST to a Jooby-compatible Context.
DefaultWebRequestContext.ConvertingRouter
 
DefaultWebRequestContext.DefaultConverter
 
DefaultWebRequestContext.Wrapper<T>
 
DefaultWebRequestGateway
Default implementation of the WebRequestGateway interface that delegates requests to a configured GenericGateway.
DefaultWebResponseMapper
Default implementation of WebResponseMapper that converts handler return values into WebResponse objects.
DefaultWebSocketContainerProvider
The default ContainerProvider used to create and manage websocket sessions with Flux Platform.
DelegatingClock
A concrete implementation of a Clock that delegates its method calls to another Clock instance, allowing runtime manipulation of the delegated clock.
DelegatingEntity<T>
A base implementation of Entity that forwards all method calls to a delegated Entity instance.
DelegatingUserProvider
An extendable UserProvider that delegates to another UserProvider.
DeleteCollection
Command to delete an entire search collection, removing all documents within it.
DeleteDocument
A bulk update operation that deletes a document from a given collection using its ID.
DeleteDocumentById
Command to delete a single document from the search store by its collection and ID.
DeleteDocuments
Command to delete documents from the search store based on a search query.
DeleteEvents
Command to permanently delete all events associated with a specific aggregate ID.
DeleteValue
Command to delete a value from the legacy key-value store by key.
DeserializationException
Thrown to indicate that a problem occurred during the deserialization of data.
DeserializingMessage
Wrapper for a Message that supports lazy deserialization, context caching, type adaptation, and batch-level execution utilities.
DeserializingMessage.MessageSpliterator
 
DeserializingMessageParameterResolver
Resolves handler method parameters of type DeserializingMessage.
DeserializingObject<T,S>
A wrapper around a SerializedObject that supports lazy deserialization of its payload.
DirectExecutorService
A simple implementation of AbstractExecutorService that executes tasks directly in the calling thread without using any worker threads.
DisableMetrics
Interceptor that disables the dispatch of outbound MessageType.METRICS messages.
DisconnectEvent
A platform-generated event that indicates a client has disconnected from the Flux platform.
DisconnectTracker
Command used to explicitly disconnect a tracker from the Flux platform and release any claimed message segments.
DispatchInterceptor
Mechanism that enables modification, monitoring, or conditional suppression of messages before they are dispatched to local handlers or published to the Flux platform.
Document
Represents a structured, searchable, and indexable document within a Flux Capacitor collection.
Document.Entry
Represents a typed field value within a document (e.g. text, number, boolean).
Document.EntryType
Enumerates the supported types of values that can appear in a Document entry.
Document.Path
Represents a navigable field access path for a Document entry.
DocumentHandlerDecorator
A HandlerDecorator that intercepts handler methods annotated with HandleDocument and synchronizes their return values with a DocumentStore.
DocumentSerializer
Interface for converting domain objects to and from SerializedDocument instances for indexing and searching.
DocumentStats
Represents aggregate statistics for a group of documents, including values for specified fields.
DocumentStats.FieldStats
Statistical summary for a single document field.
DocumentStore
Interface for storing, updating, and querying documents in the Flux Capacitor platform.
DocumentStoreException
This class represents an exception that is thrown by the DocumentStore when a document store operation fails.
DocumentUpdate
Represents a single low-level document update operation to be applied to a search collection.
Downcast
Declares a method that transforms an object from a newer revision to an older one.
DropProtectedData
Indicates that a message handler method or constructor is the final usage point for protected data.
Encryption
Defines a contract for encrypting and decrypting sensitive values within the system.
Entity<T>
Represents an entity that encapsulates domain behavior and state.
EntityHelper
Strategy interface for handling domain entity operations such as applying updates, validating state transitions, and intercepting updates.
EntityId
Marks a property (field or getter) as the unique identifier of an entity within an aggregate structure.
EntityParameterResolver
Resolves handler method parameters that reference an Entity or the entity's value.
Entry<T>
Represents a key-value pair with a string-based identifier.
EnvironmentVariablesSource
A PropertySource that resolves property values from system environment variables.
ErrorGateway
Gateway interface for reporting errors during message handling.
ErrorHandler<T>
Functional interface for handling errors during tasks.
ErrorHandler
An interface to handle errors encountered during message tracking and processing, with the ability to retry operations.
ErrorReportingInterceptor
HandlerInterceptor that reports exceptions to the configured ErrorGateway.
ErrorResult
A generic error response returned when a request could not be completed successfully.
EventBatch
Represents a batch of serialized events for a specific aggregate.
EventBatch.Metric
A compact metric representation of an EventBatch, used in AppendEvents.Metric.
EventGateway
Gateway for publishing event messages to Flux Capacitor.
EventPublication
Controls whether an applied update should result in event publication.
EventPublicationStrategy
Strategy for controlling how applied updates (typically from @Apply methods) are handled in terms of storage and publication.
EventSourcingEndpoint
 
EventSourcingException
Thrown when an event sourcing operation fails.
EventStore
High-level abstraction for accessing and storing domain events in an event-sourced system.
EventStoreClient
Low-level client interface for interacting with the event store in Flux Capacitor.
ExistsConstraint
A Constraint that checks whether one or more paths exist in a document.
Facet
Marker annotation on fields and methods that indicates that a property is to be used as facet when indexing a document for search.
FacetConstraint
A constraint that matches documents containing a specific FacetEntry.
FacetEntry
Represents a single facet field-value pair within a document.
FacetStats
Represents the count of documents matching a specific facet value.
FileUtils
Utility class for reading and writing files and classpath resources.
FilterContent
Declares that a method should be invoked to filter the visibility of an object for a specific User.
FlowRegulator
Interface for controlling flow regulation in a consumer.
FluxCapacitor
High-level entry point for all interactions with the Flux Capacitor platform.
FluxCapacitorBuilder
Builder interface for constructing a FluxCapacitor instance.
FluxCapacitorCustomizer
Callback interface that can be implemented by Spring beans to customize the FluxCapacitorBuilder before it is used to build the main FluxCapacitor instance.
FluxCapacitorInterceptor
A BatchInterceptor that ensures the correct FluxCapacitor instance is bound to the current thread for the duration of a MessageBatch.
FluxCapacitorLogbackAppender
A Logback-compatible appender that automatically publishes warning and error-level log events to the Flux Capacitor platform.
FluxCapacitorSpringConfig
Spring configuration class for automatically wiring and initializing common Flux Capacitor components in a Spring application context.
FluxPrototype
Wrapper class representing a prototype-scoped Spring handler type within Flux Capacitor.
ForbidsAnyRole
Indicates that a handler method, class, package, or payload should not be invoked or processed if the current user has any of the specified roles.
ForeverRetryingErrorHandler
A specialized RetryingErrorHandler that retries failed operations indefinitely until they succeed.
FormParam
Injects an individual form field or a complete form object into a handler method parameter.
ForwardingWebConsumer
A specialized, opt-in {web request consumer that forwards incoming MessageType.WEBREQUEST messages to a locally running HTTP server.
ForwardProxyConsumer
 
FunctionalException
Base class for user-facing exceptions that are intended to be serialized and transferred across system boundaries (e.g., back to a calling client or frontend application).
GatewayClient
Low-level interface for sending SerializedMessages to a gateway (e.g. commands, events, queries).
GatewayException
 
GenericGateway
A generic message gateway for publication of messages in Flux Capacitor.
GenericTypeResolver
Utility class for resolving generic type information in class hierarchies.
GetAggregateIds
Request to retrieve all aggregate identifiers associated with a given entity ID.
GetAggregateIdsResult
Response to a GetAggregateIds request, returning a mapping of aggregate IDs to types.
GetDocument
Request to fetch a single document from the search store by ID and collection.
GetDocumentResult
Result returned in response to a GetDocument request.
GetDocumentResult.Metric
Lightweight structure for representing GetDocumentResult in Flux metrics logs.
GetDocumentStats
Request to compute statistics on documents that match a given SearchQuery.
GetDocumentStatsResult
Response to a GetDocumentStats request.
GetDocumentStatsResult.Metric
Compact summary of the result, used for internal monitoring purposes.
GetEvents
A request to fetch stored events for a specific aggregate in an event-sourced system.
GetEventsResult
Response to a GetEvents request, returning a batch of events for an aggregate.
GetEventsResult.Metric
Lightweight metric representation of a GetEventsResult used for monitoring.
GetFacetStats
Request to retrieve aggregated counts for all facet fields across documents matching the given SearchQuery.
GetFacetStatsResult
Result returned for a GetFacetStats request.
GetFacetStatsResult.Metric
Lightweight summary of the facet statistics result, used for internal metric tracking.
GetPosition
Query to retrieve the current tracked Position for a given consumer and MessageType.
GetPositionResult
Response to a GetPosition request, containing the current tracked position for a specific consumer and MessageType.
GetRelationships
Request to retrieve all aggregate relationships for a given entity ID.
GetRelationshipsResult
Response to a GetRelationships request, containing all known relationships for a given entity ID.
GetSchedule
Request to retrieve a scheduled message by its GetSchedule.scheduleId.
GetScheduleResult
Response to a GetSchedule request, containing the matching SerializedSchedule, if found.
GetSearchHistogram
Request to compute a time-based histogram over documents that match a given query.
GetSearchHistogramResult
Result of a GetSearchHistogram request.
GetValue
Request to retrieve a value from the legacy key-value store.
GetValueResult
Response to a GetValue request, returning the value associated with the given key.
GetValueResult.Metric

Group
Represents a group key for aggregating documents in DocumentStats.
GroupSearch
Represents a grouped search query in the Flux Capacitor search framework.
Guarantee
Represents a delivery or completion guarantee for messages or state changes in Flux Capacitor.

HandleCommand
Marks a method or constructor as a handler for command messages (MessageType.COMMAND).
HandleCustom
Marks a method or constructor as a handler for messages from a custom message topic.
HandleCustomFilter
A MessageFilter implementation that filters DeserializingMessage instances based on a custom topic defined in the HandleCustom annotation on handler methods.
HandleDelete
Handles incoming HTTP DELETE requests for the specified path(s).
HandleDocument
Marks a method or constructor as a handler for document messages within a search collection.
HandleDocumentFilter
A MessageFilter that routes DeserializingMessage instances to methods annotated with HandleDocument, based on the message's topic.
HandleError
Marks a method or constructor as a handler for error messages (MessageType.ERROR).
HandleEvent
Marks a method or constructor as an event handler for incoming messages of type MessageType.EVENT.
HandleGet
Handles incoming HTTP GET requests for the specified path(s).
HandleHead
Handles incoming HTTP HEAD requests for the specified path(s).
HandleMessage
Meta-annotation used to declare that an annotation marks a method as a message handler for a specific MessageType.
HandleMessageEvent
 
HandleMetrics
Marks a method or constructor as a handler for internal metrics events (MessageType.METRICS).
HandleNotification
Marks a method or constructor as a handler for notification messages (MessageType.NOTIFICATION).

Handles incoming HTTP OPTIONS requests for the specified path(s).
HandlePatch
Handles incoming HTTP PATCH requests for the specified path(s).
HandlePost
Handles incoming HTTP POST requests for the specified path(s).
HandlePut
Handles incoming HTTP PUT requests for the specified path(s).
HandleQuery
Marks a method or constructor as a handler for query messages (MessageType.QUERY).
Handler<M>
Represents a container for a message handler and the mechanism to resolve a HandlerInvoker for a given message.
Handler.DelegatingHandler<M>
Abstract base class for Handler implementations that delegate to another handler.
HandlerConfiguration<M>
Configuration object used to define how message handler methods are selected and filtered for a given message type.
HandlerDecorator
Functional interface for decorating Handler instances that process DeserializingMessage objects.
HandlerDecorator.MergedDecorator
A composite decorator that merges two decorators into one.
HandleResult
Marks a method or constructor as a handler for result messages (MessageType.RESULT).
HandlerFactory
Factory interface for creating Handler instances that process DeserializingMessages.
HandlerFilter
Represents a predicate used to determine whether a given method should be considered a valid message handler.
HandlerInspector
Utility for inspecting and constructing handler components from annotated methods.
HandlerInspector.MethodHandlerMatcher<M>
A matcher that encapsulates metadata and resolution logic for a single handler method or constructor.
HandlerInspector.ObjectHandlerMatcher<M>
A composite HandlerMatcher that delegates to a list of individual matchers.
HandlerInterceptor
Intercepts individual message handling operations, enabling cross-cutting behavior around handler invocation.
HandlerInterceptor.InterceptedHandler
Implementation of Handler that delegates to another handler and applies a HandlerInterceptor.
HandlerInvoker
Represents an invocable handler method.
HandlerInvoker.DelegatingHandlerInvoker
A HandlerInvoker that delegates all behavior to another instance.
HandlerInvoker.SimpleInvoker
A simple invoker backed by a Callable, typically used for test utilities or framework-internal logic.
HandlerMatcher<T,M>
Defines the logic to determine whether a given target object can handle a message, and how to invoke it.
HandlerMonitor
 
HandlerRegistry
Interface for registering and invoking local message handlers.
HandlerRegistry.MergedHandlerRegistry
Combines two HandlerRegistry instances into one.
HandlerRegistry.NoOpHandlerRegistry
A no-op handler registry that performs no registration or dispatch.
HandlerRepository
Repository interface for storing and retrieving @Stateful handler instances.
HandleSchedule
Marks a method or constructor as a handler for scheduled messages (MessageType.SCHEDULE).
HandleSocketClose
Handles a WebSocket connection close event.
HandleSocketHandshake
Handles a WebSocket handshake request, invoked when a client first attempts to connect using a specialised GET request.
HandleSocketMessage
Handles an incoming WebSocket message.
HandleSocketOpen
Handles the opening of a WebSocket connection (after handshake).
HandleSocketPong
Handles a PONG WebSocket frame, typically sent in response to a PING.
HandleTrace
Handles incoming HTTP TRACE requests for the specified path(s).
HandleWeb
Marks a method or meta-annotation as a handler for incoming web requests (MessageType.WEBREQUEST).
HandleWebResponse
Marks a method as a handler for MessageType.WEBRESPONSE messages.

A request to check whether a document exists in a given collection.

Object that represents the identifier of a specific entity.
IdentityProvider
Strategy interface for generating unique identifiers used throughout the Flux platform.
IllegalCommandException

ImmutableEntity<T>

IndexDocument
A bulk update operation that indexes (inserts or replaces) a document in the store.
IndexDocumentIfNotExists
A bulk update operation that indexes a document only if it does not already exist in the store.
IndexDocuments
Command used to index a collection of SerializedDocument instances in the search store.
IndexDocuments.Metric
 
IndexOperation
Builder-style interface for indexing documents into the DocumentStore.
IndexUtils
Use 48 bits of the current time in milliseconds since epoch as the base of the index.
InMemoryEventStore
An implementation of the EventStoreClient interface that provides an in-memory event storage solution.
InMemoryKeyValueStore
An in-memory implementation of the KeyValueClient interface.
InMemoryMessageStore
An in-memory implementation of the MessageStore interface for storing SerializedMessages without external persistence.
InMemoryPositionStore
 
InMemoryScheduleStore
An in-memory implementation of a scheduling store that allows the scheduling, retrieval, and management of scheduled messages.
InMemorySearchStore
In-memory implementation of the SearchClient, intended for local testing and development.
InMemoryTaskScheduler
An in-memory implementation of the TaskScheduler interface, enabling scheduling and execution of tasks in a virtualized time environment.
InMemoryTaskScheduler.Task
 
InputParameterResolver
Resolves handler method parameters by simply injecting the input if the parameter type is assignable from the input type.
InterceptApply
Indicates that a method should intercept and potentially transform an update before it is applied to an entity.
Inverter<T>
Interface responsible for converting a domain object into a SerializedDocument for indexing, and vice versadeserializing a byte[] representation into the original object type.
Invocation
Tracks the lifecycle and identity of a single message handler invocation.
JacksonContentFilter
A ContentFilter implementation that uses Jackson to filter content dynamically for a specific User.
JacksonContentFilter.FilteringSerializer
Custom Jackson serializer that attempts to invoke a FilterContent handler method during serialization.
JacksonInverter
Implementation of Inverter that uses Jackson to invert an Object into a SerializedDocument and back into a JsonNode.
JacksonSerializer
A concrete Serializer implementation based on Jackson.
JavaPropertiesSource
Base class for PropertySource implementations backed by a Properties object.
JsonType
Marker interface for all low-level request and response types in the Flux protocol.
JsonUtils
Utility class for JSON serialization, deserialization, and file-based JSON resource loading.
Jsr380Validator
This validator uses JSR 380 annotations.
KeyValueClient
Represents a service to store and retrieve a piece of serialized data by key.

A simple interface for storing, retrieving, and removing key-value pairs.

Thrown when a key-value store operation fails.

Provides utilities for bridging Java reflection with Kotlin reflection.
LazyAggregateRoot<T>
A lazily-loaded implementation of AggregateRoot that defers deserialization and event application until the entity value is explicitly accessed.
LazyId
A lazily initialized identifier that serializes as a plain string.
LocalClient
An in-memory Client implementation used for local development, testing, or isolated runtime environments where no connection to the Flux Platform is required.
LocalDocumentHandlerRegistry
A handler registry implementation intended for local testing and development that registers handlers for document updates in a specific collection.
LocalEventStoreClient
A client implementation for managing and storing events in an in-memory event store.
LocalHandler
Marks a message handler method, class, or package as a **local handler**one that is invoked immediately in the publishing thread rather than asynchronously through tracking.
LocalHandlerRegistry
In-memory implementation of HandlerRegistry that manages and dispatches local message handlers i.e., handlers that are invoked directly in the publishing thread without involving the Flux platform.
LocalSchedulingClient
A client implementation for managing scheduling operations using an in-memory schedule store.
LocalServerConfig
Configuration for the local HTTP server used to handle WebRequest messages outside of Flux Capacitor's own web handling framework.
LocalTrackingClient
In-memory implementation of the TrackingClient and GatewayClient interfaces, designed for local-only or test-time usage.
LoggingErrorHandler
The default ErrorHandler implementation used by Flux Capacitor consumers.
LookAheadConstraint
A constraint that supports search-as-you-type functionality by matching terms or phrases that start with a given input string.
MappingBatchInterceptor
A BatchInterceptor specialization that transforms a MessageBatch before it is passed to the consumer for processing.
MatchConstraint
A constraint that matches indexed document values based on text equality or normalized phrase matching.

Indicates that the annotated field or getter represents a nested entity or collection of entities within an aggregate.

Abstraction for invoking a Member (e.g.

A Function that memoizes (caches) its results by key.
MemoizingSupplier<T>
A Supplier that memoizes (caches) the result of a single computation.
Message
Represents a unit of communication within the Flux platform, wrapping a payload and its metadata.
MessageBatch
Represents a batch of messages retrieved from the message store for a specific segment range.
MessageBatch.Metric
Compact summary of a MessageBatch, used for logging and performance tracking.
MessageFilter<M>
Defines a predicate that determines whether a given message is applicable to a handler method.

A functional interface for formatting DeserializingMessage instances into human-readable strings.
MessageParameterResolver

A DispatchInterceptor that assigns a routing segment to messages prior to dispatch.

Interface for scheduling deferred or periodic execution of messages in the Flux Capacitor platform.
MessageStore
A low-level store for serialized messages.
MessageType
Enumerates the types of messages recognized and routed by the Flux platform.
Metadata
Represents immutable metadata associated with a Message in the Flux platform.
MetadataParameterResolver
Resolves handler method parameters of type Metadata.
MetricsGateway

MetricsLog

Murmur3
The MurmurHash3 algorithm was created by Austin Appleby and placed in the public domain.
MutableHandler<M>
A specialized Handler that maintains and mutates an internal delegate instance.
NamedCache
A Cache implementation that wraps a delegate cache and applies a transformation to each key (ID) before delegating operations to the underlying cache.
NoOpCache
 
NoOpConstraint
A Constraint implementation that matches all documents and imposes no filtering conditions.
NoOpEncryption
A no-op implementation of the Encryption interface that performs no actual encryption or decryption.
NoOpEntity<T>
A read-only, inert Entity wrapper used exclusively during the loading phase of aggregate state.
NoOpFlowRegulator
A no-op implementation of the FlowRegulator interface that never requests a pause.
NoOpMetricsLog
 
NoOpPropertySource
A no-operation PropertySource implementation that never returns any property values.
NoOpSnapshotStore
A SnapshotStore implementation that is used when snapshotting is explicitly disabled, such as when snapshotPeriod <= 0 is configured on an aggregate via Aggregate.
NoOpTypeRegistry
 
NoSnapshotTrigger
A SnapshotTrigger implementation that never triggers snapshot creation.
NotConstraint
A constraint that negates the result of another constraint.
NullCollectionsAsEmptyModule
A custom Jackson module that configures deserialization behavior to treat null collections as empty collections.

PathConstraint

Position
Represents the tracking state of a consumer, i.e. the last known indexes of consumed messages per segment.

Request
Base class for requests sent to the Flux platform.
Request<R>
Marker interface for request messages (e.g., commands or queries) that expect a response of a specific type.
RequestAnnotationProcessor
Annotation processor that validates whether handler methods annotated with HandleCommand, HandleQuery or HandleCustom correctly match the response type declared by a Request payload.
RequestBatch<T>
Represents a batch of requests to be sent to the Flux platform in a single network round-trip.
RequestHandler
Handles the lifecycle of request/response interactions in a Flux Capacitor client.
RequestResult
Marker interface for responses to Request objects (including commands and queries).
RequiresAnyRole
Declares role-based access control for message handlers or payload types.
RequiresNoUser
This annotation allows a message handler or payload to be invoked even if the current user is not authenticated.
RequiresUser
Indicates that a handler or message requires the presence of an authenticated user.
ResetPosition
Command to forcibly reset the tracked position for a given consumer and message type.
ResponseMapper
A strategy interface for converting arbitrary response objects into Message instances.
ResultBatch
Represents a batch of results returned from the Flux platform in response to a RequestBatch.
ResultGateway
Gateway interface for sending result messages in response to a command or query.
RetryConfiguration
Configuration for retry behavior when executing a task using TimingUtils.retryOnFailure(java.lang.Runnable, java.time.Duration).
RetryingErrorHandler
An ErrorHandler implementation that retries failed operations a configurable number of times, with optional propagation or suppression of unrecoverable errors.
RetryStatus
Represents the current status of a retry operation.
Revision
Specifies the revision number of a persistable object, such as a message payload, document, or aggregate snapshot.
RoutingKey
Annotation used to identify the routing key of a message, which in turn is used to compute the message segment using consistent hashing.
Schedule
Command to schedule a batch of messages for future delivery.
Schedule
Represents a scheduled message to be delivered at a specific future time.
Schedule.Metric
Lightweight metric representation of this Schedule command, used for monitoring purposes.
ScheduledCommand
Wrapper for a serialized command message scheduled for deferred execution.
ScheduledCommandHandler
Internal handler responsible for executing scheduled commands when they are due.
SchedulerException

A lower-level client interface for scheduling and cancelling deferred messages (i.e., schedules) in Flux Capacitor.
SchedulingEndpoint

Intercepts scheduled messages to handle periodic scheduling logic.
Search

Searchable

SearchInclude

A MessageFilter that restricts handler invocation based on segment membership, using routing keys.
SelectiveCache
A Cache implementation that partitions values across two internal caches based on a provided Predicate.

ServicePathBuilder

ServiceUrlBuilder

SetRetentionTime
Command to set or update the retention period for a message log in the Flux platform.

A functional, non-persistent Entity wrapper that enables safe state mutation and validation without producing side effects such as event publication or snapshot creation.
SilentErrorHandler
An ErrorHandler implementation that suppresses all processing errors and allows message tracking to continue.
SimplePropertySource

SnapshotStore

SocketSession

Sortable

A PropertySource implementation that delegates property lookups to a Spring Environment.
StallingBatchInterceptor
A BatchInterceptor that stalls batch processing until a minimum desired batch size is reached or a timeout occurs.
Stateful
Declares that a class is a stateful message handler i.e., one whose state is persisted and which can receive messages via Association.
StatefulHandler
A Handler implementation for classes annotated with Stateful, responsible for resolving and invoking stateful handler instances based on Association metadata.

Spring BeanDefinitionRegistryPostProcessor that automatically detects beans annotated with Stateful and registers them as FluxPrototype definitions for use in Flux Capacitor.

Command sent to the Flux platform to update the tracked position for a specific consumer and segment range.

ThrowingConsumer<T>
Functional counterpart to Consumer that allows the ThrowingConsumer.accept(Object) method to throw a checked Exception.
ThrowingErrorHandler
An ErrorHandler implementation that forcefully halts message tracking by throwing any encountered errors.
ThrowingFunction<T,R>
Equivalent of Function whose ThrowingFunction.apply(Object) method may throw a checked Exception.
ThrowingRunnable

TrackerCluster

TrackerMonitor

The Tracking interface provides a mechanism to start and manage the tracking of messages by a given set of handlers.
TrackingClient

TrackingException

TrackingStrategy

TrackSelf
Indicates that a message payload class can handle itself as a message handler.

Injects the **triggering message** that caused the current message to be published or handled.

WebHandlerMatcher
